conclusion: Determine the initial acceleration of block A using Newton's second law.
Two wooden blocks A and B connected by a light spring, initially at rest.
Gravitational force on each block is mg.
Applied force on block A is F.
Spring force acts between blocks A and B.
Both blocks are initially at rest and the spring is in equilibrium.
When a vertical upward force F is applied to block A, it must overcome gravitational force mg and spring force.
Spring force F_s = kx balances gravitational force on block B when B just leaves the ground.
Sum of forces on block A: F - mg - F_s.
Net force is F - mg - kx.
Using F = ma, F - mg - kx = ma.
Since kx balances mg when B leaves the ground, kx = mg.
Simplify the equation to F - mg - mg = ma, then F - 2mg = ma.
The initial acceleration a of block A is a = (F - 2mg) / m.
